derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Latin, past participle of emereri 'earn one's discharge by service', from e- (variant of ex-) 'out of, from' + mereri 'earn'

entry.tran: （与专业头衔连用）荣誉退休的
entry.def: Emeritus is used with a professional title to indicate that the person bearing it has retired but keeps the title as an honour.

example.tran: 荣誉退休的物理学教授

example.ex: He will continue as chairman emeritus.
example.tran: 他将继续担任荣誉主席。

means.word_mean: 1. honorably retired from assigned duties and retaining your title along with the additional title `emeritus' as in `professor emeritus'; `retired from assigned duties' need not imply that one is inactive
